result.execSummary:
The defendant Ian T Geiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay $100.00 fine plus court costs. $350.00 of bond money applied toward fines/costs. **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-------------------------

No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No driving without a valid driver's license.
-------------------------

Contact with the victim as allowed by restraining order only.   Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. 
-------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-------------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Defendant Ian T Geiss in court with attorney Francis Raff for Rebecca Hammock.  Matthew W. Surridge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Bond remains.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ian T Geiss in court with attorney Rebecca Hammock.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 10:33 a.m. Appearances made. Hammock makes record of agreed sentence on 15CM281.

Count #2 is DISMISSED AND READ-IN.
